jcurses.widgets
Class BorderLayoutManager

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--jcurses.widgets.BorderLayoutManager
All Implemented Interfaces:
LayoutManager
public class BorderLayoutManager
extends java.lang.Object
implements LayoutManager

This class is a layout manager that works like Swing's BorderLayout. Up to 5 widgets can be added to this layout at once, in the following positions: NORTH, SOUTH, WEST, EAST, and CENTER. Components in the outer positions are set to their preferred size, and the component in the CENTER is allocated the remaining screen area.

Method Detail

bindToContainer

public void bindToContainer(WidgetContainer container)
Description copied from interface: LayoutManager
The method is called by framework by binding the layout manager to an container. The implementing class must register, whether this is already bound or not, and throw an exception by a try to bind it second time. This is because the framework restricts, that a lyout manager can be bound only to one container at a time.
Specified by:
bindToContainer in interface LayoutManager
Following copied from interface: jcurses.widgets.LayoutManager
Parameters:
container - container to bind

unbindFromContainer

public void unbindFromContainer()
Description copied from interface: LayoutManager
The method is called by framework by unbinding the layout manager from its container. The implementing class must register, whether this is already bound or not, and throw an exception by a try to bind it second time. This is because the framework restricts, that a lyout manager can be bound only to one container at a time.
Specified by:
unbindFromContainer in interface LayoutManager

addWidget

public void addWidget(Widget widget,
                      int position,
                      int verticalConstraint,
                      int horizontalConstraint)
Adds a widget to the bounded container
Parameters:
widget - widget to be added
position - the position in the border layout. The following values are possible: NORTH, SOUTH, WEST, EAST, CENTER,
verticalConstraint - vertical alignment constraint. The following values are possible: WidgetConstraints.ALIGNMENT_CENTER, WidgetConstraints.ALIGNMENT_TOP, WidgetConstraints.ALIGNMENT_BOTTOM
horizontalConstraint - vertical alignment constraint, The following values are possible: WidgetConstraints.ALIGNMENT_CENTER, WidgetConstraints.ALIGNMENT_LEFT, WidgetConstraints.ALIGNMENT_RIGHT
